tool.name: qiime2 emperor plot
tool.description: Visualize and Interact with Principal Coordinates Analysis Plots

param.name: pcoa
param.label: pcoa: PCoAResults
param.help: [required] The principal coordinates matrix to be plotted.

repeat.name: custom_axes
repeat.help: [optional] Numeric sample metadata columns that should be included as axes in the Emperor plot.
repeat.title: custom_axes: List[Str]

param.name: element
param.label: element: Str
param.validator: value is not None and len(value) > 0

param.name: ignore_missing_samples
param.label: ignore_missing_samples: Bool
param.help: [default: No] This will suppress the error raised when the coordinates matrix contains samples that are not present in the metadata. Samples without metadata are included by setting all metadata values to: "This sample has no metadata". This flag is only applied if at least one sample is present in both the coordinates matrix and the metadata.

param.name: ignore_pcoa_features
param.label: ignore_pcoa_features: Bool
param.help: [default: No] Biplot arrows cannot be visualized using this method. If you want to visualize biplot arrows use the `biplot` method. Enabling this setting will ignore any PCoA features that are present, otherwise, if PCoA features are detected an error will be raised.

tool.help:
QIIME 2: emperor plot ===================== Visualize and Interact with Principal Coordinates Analysis Plots
Outputs: -------- :visualization.qzv: <no description>
|
Description: ------------ Generates an interactive ordination plot where the user can visually integrate sample metadata.
Examples: ---------
emperor_plot ************ Using the ``qiime2 emperor plot`` tool: #. Set *"pcoa"* to ``#: pcoa-result.qza`` #. For *"metadata"*:
- Perform the following steps.
#. Leave as ``Metadata from TSV`` #. Set *"Metadata Source"* to ``sample-metadata.tsv``
#. Press the ``Execute`` button.
Once completed, for the new entry in your history, use the ``Edit`` button to set the name as follows: (Renaming is optional, but it will make any subsequent steps easier to complete.)
.. list-table:: :align: left :header-rows: 1
* - History Name - *"Name"* to set (be sure to press ``Save``) * - ``#: qiime2 emperor plot [...] : visualization.qzv`` - ``plot.qzv``
|
